awd_titl_txt: Aspartic Acid Racemization Dating of the Recent             Paleoenvironmental Record in Cores from Lake Titicaca
awd_abstract_narration: ABSTRACT    P.I.Glenn Goodfriend   SBR-9312787    A number of new dating techniques for use in archaeology are currently in the development stages.  Of these, aspartic acid racemization on shell of various sorts (particluarly ostrich egg shell) is the most exciting and reliable, covering new ranges of dates that other techniques are inadequate for.      The current  small project will be the first application of this technique to especially recent excavations from Lake Titicaca around the time of colonization.  It will allow for a more detailed understanding of the dynamics surrounding a number of events, including environmental alteration/degradation, that happened around that time.  It will also allow refinement of the dating techniques themselves.  ***  P\anthro\jfried\9312787.abs        PIF           Cp  ) !   LIST    PIF            U  . !   PHON_WINPIF            r> 9 !
